content:
Your rough outline provides a good starting point for an argumentative paper. Here are targeted, detailed, and actionable suggestions for improvement:

I. People can choose to be happy for the little things that happen in their lives.
A. Expand on the concession: Explain why certain situations may prevent individuals from finding happiness in small things.
B. Counter Arguments
1. Focusing on the frequency of positive moments makes people happy.
a. Provide specific examples from research, such as a study with concrete data supporting the statement.
2. Not waiting for big positive moments to come by
a. Offer evidence or case studies to illustrate how waiting for big moments leads to disappointment.
3. The amount of gratitude a happy person has
a. Further explain the role of gratitude in happiness and provide specific examples from research or personal stories.

II. A happy person chooses to see the positive side of things.
A. Expand on the concession: Explain the risks of being overly positive and provide examples of when it may be problematic.
B. Counter Arguments
1. People will not ignore their difficulties/adversities but overcome them.
a. Provide more examples and research to support this statement. Consider adding statistics or study results.
2. People will use the pain and suffering to learn and become stronger.
a. Add more examples or case studies illustrating how individuals have turned their adversities into strengths.
